headline: What’s the plan, Chuck?
sentences:
House Sergeant at Arms William Walker told an appropriations subpanel Tuesday he directly asked some lawmakers and staff to don masks, and while some listened to him, "some just walk away from me.”
At the same hearing, Capitol Police Chief Thomas Manger told lawmakers there were as many as 200 officers currently in isolation due to the virus, with others still on leave due to long-term effects of the virus.

MONEY TALKS — After preliminary discussions over the weekend between Senate leaders and top appropriators about moving omnibus spending legislation before the Feb. 18 deadline, the group — Schumer (D-N.Y.), Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell (R-Ky.), Appropriations Committee Chair Patrick Leahy (D-Vt.) and Appropriations Committee ranking member Richard Shelby (R-Ala.) — met again Tuesday.
